origination.corpname: Lutheran Church in America. Michigan Synod.

did.unittitle: Lutheran Church in America, Michigan Synod records 1917-1987
did.abstract: President's correspondence, executive committee minutes, and minutes of annual conventions; also files on individual churches in the Synod, including clippings, reports, church histories and programs; and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was deposited by the Michigan Synod, Lutheran Church in America (Donor No. 5738) in August 1975. Periodic additions have been received since then.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regent of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Lutheran Church in America, Michigan Synod records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Lutheran Church in America was formed from the merger in 1962 of four Lutheran groups: the United Lutheran Church in America, the Augustana Evangelical Lutheran Church, the American Evangelical Lutheran Church, and the Finnish Evangelical Lutheran Church. In 1988, the LCA merged with the American Lutheran Church and the much smaller Association of Evangelical Lutheran Churches to form the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.
The first annual convention of the Michigan Synod was held in Detroit in June 1920.

scopecontent.p: The records of the Michigan Synod of the Lutheran Church in America include president's correspondence; executive committee minutes; and minutes of annual conventions; files on individual churches in the Synod, including clippings, reports, church histories and programs; and photographs. The records have been arranged into the following series: Organizational and Administrative Records; Archivist's files; Organizational units and programs; Lutheran Church Women; Printed material; Church files; Topical files; and Visual Materials. Most of the records prior to 1962 originally came from the archives of United Lutheran Church in America.

scopecontent.p: The Organizational and Administrative Records series includes president's correspondence, executive committee minutes, minutes of the Synod's annual convention, and records from the organization and constituting conventions of the Michigan Synod in 1962.

did.unittitle: Minutes of Michigan Synod Annual Conventions 1917-1933
Minutes of Michigan Synod Annual Conventions 1934-1986
Organization and constituting convention of the Michigan Synod 1962

scopecontent.p: The Archivist's files is a smaller series of collected materials on individual churches within the Synod, various reports, and other materials considered to be of historical importance.

did.unittitle: Publications of individual churches, national publications, convention miscellanea, reports, etc. 1953-1974

scopecontent.p: The records of various Organizational Units and Programs within the Synod have been grouped together. This series includes minutes of the meetings of the Eastern and Western Conference of the Michigan Synod, minutes of the United Lutheran Pastor's Association, minutes of the Luther League, and records from the Gun Lake Summer Camp program. This series also contains extensive material on the Joint Commission on Lutheran Unity and files detailing the missions and social services activities of the Synod.

did.unittitle: Minutes of meetings of Eastern and Western Conferences (Michigan Synod) 1944-1961
Minutes and Record General of the Western Conference (Michigan Synod) 1944-1963
Minutes of United Lutheran Pastor's Association 1924-1944
Luther League, minutes of executive meetings and conventions 1942-1962
Department of Research and Church Planning files
Notebooks concerning Lutheran schools and seminaries
Notebooks concerning the Counsel of Synodical Presidents
Notebooks concerning the Lutheran Church in the United States
Notebooks concerning the Joint Commission on Lutheran Unity
Notebooks concerning the Joint Commission on Lutheran Unity
Notebooks concerning the Michigan Joint Committee on Lutheran Unity

scopecontent.p: The Lutheran Church Women records cover the years 1961 to 1973, beginning with the planning and foundation of the organization, but ending abruptly twelve years later. While the bulk of the series pertains specifically to the Michigan Synod of the LCA, there is also some material pertaining to LCW on the national level.

The national files includes minutes and other material from the Constituting Convention of the organization and the Leadership Training Session which immediately followed the convention. The LCW Guide contains information on the history, purpose and structure of the organization.

The Michigan Synod LCW records include agendas and minutes of the Executive Board Meetings covering the years 1962-1973. These are a good source of information on the administration and basic functions of the organization. Minutes include regular reports from the treasurer outlining the financial management of the LCW, as well as periodic reports from the standing committees. The LCW annual conventions files begin with the Constituting Convention in 1962 and end in 1973. The conventions files are an excellent source for summary information on the aims and activities of the LCW. While these files usually include the program and minutes for each year, the folders for the conventions from 1967 to 1970 are particularly rich, including committee reports, minutes of the convention, summary evaluations of the conventions and budgeting and planning information.

did.unittitle: History of Women's Missionary Society (name changed in 1955 to United Lutheran Church Women)
Women's Missionary Society, Minutes of conventions and other printed material
Leadership-Membership Development in Lutheran Church Women (1964 booklet)

scopecontent.p: The Printed material series includes newsletters and other publications of the Michigan Synod.

The Church files series is the largest in the Synod record group. Except for files of parochial and pastors reports, the series is arranged alphabetically by city, then name of church. The files include communications between the individual church and the Synod, financial and other reports required by the Synod, anniversary and other programs of events, and collected information. In the case of Hope Evangelical Lutheran Church of Detroit, the files also includes record books maintained by the church.

scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous subject files relating in part to the Synod's relationship with the Metropolitan Detroit Council of Churches and the Michigan Council of Churches have been arranged alphabetically into a Topical files series. Other topics in this series relate to organizational issues, to denominational groups, and to the seminaries of the denomination.

did.unittitle: Applications of congregations for membership in the Michigan Synod

Seminary merger (Hamma Divinity and Chicago Lutheran Seminary
Survey report and proposal to the Lutheran Church in America

scopecontent.p: The Visual Materials series consists of photographs, albums, photographic negatives, and other formats. This material is largely arranged alphabetically by place. Subjects include church buildings, events, and people associated with the various churches.

did.unittitle: Detroit. Lutheran Church of the Cross, St. Jean and Charlevoix area; includes Tendler schools

odd.p: (arranged alphabetically by name of county, then by city)
